HTML:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD85676

Aperçu du poste

Autodesk a investi dans la prise de décision basée sur les données, optimisant l'activité, le produit et le coût de notre plateforme. Les cinq prochaines années transformeront notre façon de travailler, avec une explosion du volume de données et une mise à l'échelle de l'IA/ML pour offrir une valeur encore plus grande à nos clients. Nous recherchons un analyste de données senior pour rejoindre l'organisation Platform Strategy and Emerging Technologies d'Autodesk dans ce voyage de transformation et pour favoriser la prise de décision éclairée par les données grâce à des analyses de données et des perspectives avancées.

Vous êtes passionné par la production d'informations proactives et le partenariat avec les parties prenantes pour générer des analyses qui influencent les décisions relatives à la feuille de route des produits. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l'autonomisation des équipes de produits en faisant émerger des données précieuses sur l'utilisation des clients et des produits et en agissant en tant que partenaire de réflexion, en les guidant dans la transformation des idées en actions stratégiques. Votre expertise dans la découverte des tendances et la traduction de grands flux de données en informations claires et exploitables fera avancer les initiatives stratégiques de la plateforme et améliorera la prise de décision dans l'ensemble de notre organisation.

Ce poste sera basé à Toronto, ON, Canada ou à Montréal, Canada dans une capacité hybride/à distance. Ce poste est placé sous la responsabilité du directeur principal de l'analyse.

Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée d'habiliter les équipes et d'influencer l'organisation avec des connaissances qui mènent au succès, ce poste est pour vous !

Responsabilités

  • Collaborer avec les chefs de produit et les équipes interfonctionnelles pour identifier, définir et traiter les problèmes et les opportunités de l'entreprise par le biais de l'analyse des données. Utiliser vos compétences analytiques pour obtenir des informations exploitables à partir d'ensembles de données vastes et complexes
  • Contrôler et suivre les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI), les objectifs et les résultats clés (OKR) dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme, en fournissant des mises à jour et des informations régulières aux principales parties prenantes et en garantissant la visibilité des informations fondées sur les données qui soutiennent les objectifs de l'organisation
  • Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de produits, d'ingénierie et d'affaires pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données, fournir un soutien analytique et communiquer les résultats de manière claire et concise à des publics techniques et non techniques
  • Créer des visualisations de données claires et percutantes à l'aide d'outils tels que Power BI, Looker ou similaires, afin de communiquer les résultats et les recommandations aux parties prenantes de l'organisation
  • Rechercher de manière proactive des données pour soutenir les initiatives de la plateforme PSET, en se concentrant sur la performance, l'engagement des utilisateurs et l'impact global sur l'entreprise
  • Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles de données avancés et des analyses statistiques pour prévoir les tendances, prédire les résultats et optimiser les processus de prise de décision dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme
  • Garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données en suivant les meilleures pratiques en matière de collecte, de nettoyage et d'analyse des données, ce qui permet d'obtenir des informations de grande qualité. Identifier et résoudre les divergences de données si nécessaire

Qualifications Minimales

  • Plus de 5 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de grandes données, la veille stratégique ou un domaine connexe, de préférence dans un environnement technologique ou SaaS
  • Baccalauréat dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe
  • Solides compétences en matière d'interrogation et de manipulation de données avec SQL, et maîtrise de langages de programmation tels que Python ou R pour l'analyse et la modélisation des données
  • Expérience des outils ELT pour entrepôts de données (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
  • Expérience des outils de visualisation de données tels que Looker, Power BI ou similaires, avec la capacité de créer des tableaux de bord clairs, attrayants et percutants. Familiarité avec AWS, Azure ou des plateformes cloud similaires
  • Aptitudes avérées à l'analyse et à la résolution de problèmes, avec la capacité de travailler de manière autonome sur des ensembles de données complexes et d'en tirer des enseignements exploitables
  • Connaissance des techniques statistiques et des méthodologies de modélisation pour obtenir des informations approfondies sur les données et soutenir l'analyse prédictive
  • Forte capacité à communiquer de manière claire et accessible des données complexes et des recommandations aux parties prenantes techniques et non techniques
  • Esprit d'équipe efficace avec une forte capacité à travailler avec plusieurs fonctions, à s'engager avec diverses parties prenantes et à fournir un soutien basé sur les données pour les initiatives stratégiques

Qualifications Souhaitées

  • Expérience préalable au sein d'une entreprise SaaS ou d'une organisation d'ingénierie de plateforme
  • Une bonne connaissance du portefeuille de produits Autodesk et de ses applications dans divers secteurs d'activité est un atout
  • Maîtrise dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe

Position Overview

Autodesk has invested in data-driven decision-making, optimizing our platform’s business, product, and cost. The next five years will transform how we work, with a surge in data volume and scaling of AI/ML to provide even greater value to our customers. We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join Autodesk’s Platform Strategy and Emerging Technologies organization on this transformative journey and to drive data-informed decision-making through advanced data analytics and insights.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization.

This role will be based in Toronto, ON, Canada or Montreal, Canada in a hybrid/ remote capacity. This role reports into the Senior Manager, Analytics.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
  • Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
  • Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
  • Proactively mine for data drive insights to support PSET's platform initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact.
  • Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
  • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
  • Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling
  • Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
  • Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
  • Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
  • Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
  • Familiarity with Autodesk’s product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
  • Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline

Title: Data Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Description

A top investment firm based in New York with offices here in Toronto is seeking a Data Insights Analyst to be part of their niche data team. The firm has over $20 billion in assets with a global client base including public and private pensions, endowments and private banks.

The Data Insights Analyst will be responsible for providing data-driven research to answer a variety of investment inquires. This position is part of the data team with responsibilities spanning from data sourcing/processing to analytics. This includes executing on strategic initiatives, such as working with Data Scientists to build ML models enabling processing and prediction at scale (e.g., sentiment analysis, product classification). The ideal candidate is an entrepreneurial self-starter who is passionate about data analysis in the investment industry.

Previous project: Conducting surveys among US optometrists to understand trends and product positioning within the contact lens market.

Required Skills And Experience


Bachelor’s degree or higher with a minimum 3.6 GPA from a competitive university
1-3 years of related experience
Experience with analysis of complex data (e.g., investment management, consulting, private equity)
Highly numeric and detail oriented, as well as skilled at creative problem solving
Big data preparation: Alteryx, Tableau, Power BI, SQL, or Python
Exceptional interpersonal and communication skills
Preferred: Previous experience with surveys, from questionnaire development to analysis and reporting


Applicants must be currently authorized to work in the Canada on a full-time basis now and in the future.

Posted By: Cara Tian

Title: Senior Data Analyst - Data Products & Insights
Description:
Job Summary

The role of the Data Products & Insights Senior Analytics Manager within the CAE Group is to drive digital transformation by developing data-driven solutions for internal audit. You will work within a high-throughput, global audit analytics team of like-minded individuals, developing sustainable, scalable, and reusable data products that enhance audit efficiency and effectiveness as part of the strategy to digitally transform the RBC CAE Group.

The RBC CAE Group leverages a unique perspective— with a coordinated view across the entire business—to deliver valuable advice that not only gives assurance, but that illuminates a bigger picture, connects dots, builds best practices and broadens possibilities. We connect intelligence to protect and enable RBC.

Job Description


Lead the design, development, and implementation of innovative data products that enhance audit efficiency and effectiveness.
Conduct in-depth analysis of large and complex datasets to identify trends, anomalies, and key risk indicators before translating findings into actionable insights for audit teams.
Ensure the quality, accuracy and integrity of data used to perform analytics during audit engagements.
Develop and implement automated processes to improve efficiency, reduce manual effort, and enhance scalability of audit analytics solutions.
Collaborate closely with audit teams to gather requirements and translate them into effective analytics solutions. Partner with other teams in the CAE Digital Innovation, Data & Analytics group to adhere to data governance standards, identify and onboard new datasets into the CAE analytics ecosystem.
Stay abreast of emerging technology, methods, and best practices around analytics and audit. Research and pilot new ideas to push boundaries and enhance audit capabilities.
Guide and mentor junior data analysts on the team.


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have :


5-7 years of relevant experience in data analytics, with strong proficiency in Python/R, SQL and data visualization software.
Bachelor’s degree in Data Science, Statistics, Computer Science, Financial Engineering, or a related quantitative field.
Excellent verbal and written communication skills, with the ability to convey technical concepts to non-technical audiences.


Job Skills

Actionable Insights, Analytical Thinking, Big Data Analytics, Critical Analysis, Critical Thinking, Data Administration, Data Analysis, Data Analytics, Data Mining, Data Modeling, Data Movement, Detail-Oriented, Emerging Technologies, Group Problem Solving, Independent Thinking, Quantitative Research, Research Documents

Additional Job Details

Address:

20 KING ST W:TORONTO

City:

TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

INTERNAL AUDIT

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2025-04-14

Application Deadline:

2025-05-30

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com</a/span>

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
At CI, we see a great place to work as one that is a safe place for everyone to have a voice, where people are empowered to take ownership over meaningful work, where there is an opportunity to grow through stretching themselves, where they can work on innovative products and projects, and where employees are supported and engaged in doing so.

We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to join the Data Solutions team in the Wealth Technology group at CI Wealth. The Data Solutions team focuses on developing data-driven solutions, driving innovation, and uncovering key insights to support strategic initiatives. The successful candidate will play a key role in leveraging data to deliver solutions that enhance decision-making, streamline business processes, and support strategic objectives.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both data analysis and business processes.

RESPONSIBILITIES:


Analyze and interpret large datasets to uncover key insights that drive business objectives.
Collaborate with stakeholders across teams to identify data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
Develop and maintain data processes that enhance efficiency and support data-driven decision-making.
Document and maintain data mapping specifications and business rules to support data governance efforts.
Assist in building reports, dashboards, and analytics tools to monitor key metrics and trends.
Identify inefficiencies in existing processes and recommend data-driven improvements.
Respond to stakeholder inquiries and data requests in a timely and effective manner.
Partner with Data Engineers to support the successful implementation of solutions.


QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Experience


2+ years of work experience in quantitative analysis.


Education/Training


Post-secondary degree in a quantitative discipline.


Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities


Strong problem-solving skills and attention to details.
Solid understanding of data and data modeling.
In-depth knowledge and experience with the following tools:
Visualization e.g., Sigma, AWS Quicksight
Modelling e.g., MS Excel
Database system e.g., PostgreSQL, Snowflake
Cloud Technology e.g., AWS, Microsoft Azure
Strong knowledge and understanding of SQL
Working knowledge and understanding of Python.
A strong analytical mindset and sophisticated written and verbal communication skills.
Experience in the Financial Services Industry is an asset.
Ability to work within an organization based upon continuous improvement.


CI Financial is an independent company offering global wealth management and asset management advisory services through diverse financial services firms. Since 1965, we have consistently anticipated and responded to the changing needs of investors. We are driven by a commitment to provide individuals and institutions with the highest-quality investments and advice. Our commitment to the highest levels of performance means that whatever their position, CI employees must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment that will stretch them to tap into their highest potential. Employees with a healthy dose of ambition, a desire to commit to a curious mindset for continuous learning, and a willingness to go the extra mile thrive at CI.

A Supportive Environment for Success

We offer an in-office environment, competitive benefits, and a supportive workplace to help our employees thrive both personally and professionally.

What We Offer


Modern HQ location within walking distance from Union Station
Training Reimbursement
Paid Professional Designations
Employee Savings Plan (ESP)
Corporate Discount Program
Enhanced group benefits
Parental Leave Top–up program
Paid time off for Volunteering


We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role and are not confident you meet all the qualification requirements, we encourage you to apply to investigate the opportunity further.

Please submit your resume in confidence by clicking “Apply”. Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (“CI”) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities. HTML:
At CI, we see a great place to work as one that is a safe place for everyone to have a voice, where people are empowered to take ownership over meaningful work, where there is an opportunity to grow through stretching themselves, where they can work on innovative products and projects, and where employees are supported and engaged in doing so.

We are currently seeking a Data Analyst to join the Data Solutions team in the Wealth Technology group at CI Wealth. The Data Solutions team focuses on developing data-driven solutions, driving innovation, and uncovering key insights to support strategic initiatives. The successful candidate will play a key role in leveraging data to deliver solutions that enhance decision-making, streamline business processes, and support strategic objectives.

The ideal candidate will have a strong background in both data analysis and business processes.

RESPONSIBILITIES:

  • Analyze and interpret large datasets to uncover key insights that drive business objectives.
  • Collaborate with stakeholders across teams to identify data needs and deliver actionable solutions.
  • Develop and maintain data processes that enhance efficiency and support data-driven decision-making.
  • Document and maintain data mapping specifications and business rules to support data governance efforts.
  • Assist in building reports, dashboards, and analytics tools to monitor key metrics and trends.
  • Identify inefficiencies in existing processes and recommend data-driven improvements.
  • Respond to stakeholder inquiries and data requests in a timely and effective manner.
  • Partner with Data Engineers to support the successful implementation of solutions.

QUALIFICATION REQUIREMENTS:

Experience

  • 2+ years of work experience in quantitative analysis.

Education/Training

  • Post-secondary degree in a quantitative discipline.

Knowledge, Skills, And Abilities

  • Strong problem-solving skills and attention to details.
  • Solid understanding of data and data modeling.
  • In-depth knowledge and experience with the following tools:
  • Visualization e.g., Sigma, AWS Quicksight
  • Modelling e.g., MS Excel
  • Database system e.g., PostgreSQL, Snowflake
  • Cloud Technology e.g., AWS, Microsoft Azure
  • Strong knowledge and understanding of SQL
  • Working knowledge and understanding of Python.
  • A strong analytical mindset and sophisticated written and verbal communication skills.
  • Experience in the Financial Services Industry is an asset.
  • Ability to work within an organization based upon continuous improvement.

CI Financial is an independent company offering global wealth management and asset management advisory services through diverse financial services firms. Since 1965, we have consistently anticipated and responded to the changing needs of investors. We are driven by a commitment to provide individuals and institutions with the highest-quality investments and advice. Our commitment to the highest levels of performance means that whatever their position, CI employees must be comfortable in a fast-paced environment that will stretch them to tap into their highest potential. Employees with a healthy dose of ambition, a desire to commit to a curious mindset for continuous learning, and a willingness to go the extra mile thrive at CI.

A Supportive Environment for Success

We offer an in-office environment, competitive benefits, and a supportive workplace to help our employees thrive both personally and professionally.

What We Offer

  • Modern HQ location within walking distance from Union Station
  • Training Reimbursement
  • Paid Professional Designations
  • Employee Savings Plan (ESP)
  • Corporate Discount Program
  • Enhanced group benefits
  • Parental Leave Top–up program
  • Paid time off for Volunteering

We are focused on building a diverse and inclusive workforce. If you are excited about this role and are not confident you meet all the qualification requirements, we encourage you to apply to investigate the opportunity further.

Please submit your resume in confidence by clicking “Apply”. Only qualified candidates selected for an interview will be contacted. CI Financial Corp. and all of our affiliates (“CI”) are committed to fair and accessible employment practices and provide reasonable accommodations for persons with disabilities. If you require accommodations in order to apply for any job opportunities, require this posting in an additional format, or require accommodation at any stage of the recruitment process please contact us at accessible.recruitment@ci.com, or call 416-364-1145 ext. 4747.

Title: Data Insights Analyst
Description:
Job Title: Data Insights Analyst

Location: Onsite, Midtown Toronto

Compensation: $120K-140K base + bonus + extensive benefits

Work Type: Full-time, 5 days/week onsite MUST HAVE

Experience Level: 1-3 years




We're working with a high-performing investment firm looking to grow their data research capabilities with a Data Insights Analyst. This is an opportunity to join a top-tier team and apply your analytical mindset to support high-impact investment decisions.




What You'll Do:

Build and deliver high-quality market/data analysis reports to help traders test hypotheses
Work with large and diverse datasets (e.g., consumer transaction data, survey results, mobile location data)
Partner closely with researchers, data scientists, and field teams on bespoke data-driven projects
Assist in developing AI-driven solutions for tasks like text classification and topic extraction




Must-Haves:

1-3 years in an Analyst role (data, business, or research focused)
Bachelor's degree with a minimum GPA of 3.6 (this will be asked)
Strong proficiency in Excel
Highly numeric, detail-oriented, and analytical
Exposure to investment management, consulting, or private equity
Experience with surveys, Alteryx, Tableau, or Power BI
Basic programming in SQL or Python

If you're curious, collaborative, and driven by data, this is a rare opportunity to work with one of the most respected research teams in the space.




Determining compensation for this role (and others) at Vaco/Highspring depends upon a wide array of factors including but not limited to the individual's skill sets, experience and training, licensure and certifications, office location and other geographic considerations, as well as other business and organizational needs. With that said, as required by local law in geographies that require salary range disclosure, Vaco/Highspring notes the salary range for the role is noted in this job posting. The individual may also be eligible for discretionary bonuses, and can participate in medical, dental, and vision benefits as well as the company's 401(k) retirement plan.

Title: Business Systems Analyst - Data
Description:
Job Summary

Job Description

What is the opportunity?

As a Business Data Analyst within RBC Investor Services you will work closely with the business and technology on data projects with focus on value proposition, clear articulation of the benefits and elicitation of functional/non-functional requirements. Data discovery, mapping, data analysis, creating wire frames, documentation, communication, stakeholder engagement, coordination with Project Manager and Data Engineering teams before and during project delivery will be the key to success for this role.

You will provide business, functional and data analysis expertise and manage stakeholder engagement with various initiatives of the Data Engineering team within Investor Services in line with corporate vision, for both projects and BAU initiatives involving data. We are looking for a functional expert and a passionate data management enthusiast with ability to support the leadership team by collaborating with stakeholders, clients, data engineers and system owners to drive delivery of the various data transformation initiatives.

As a member of a dynamic, fast paced team, this role brings strong data analysis skills, effective written and verbal communication skills, a strong work ethic and a demonstrated capability to multi-task effectively. This role requires strong interpersonal, organizational and problem-solving skills as well as a demonstrated sense of urgency to respond to changing priorities at times. This is complemented by a positive attitude and a willingness to take accountability for results achieved.

What will you do?


Work on complex data initiatives within RBC Investor Services that involve definition of the problem statement, determination of value proposition, Business case preparation and stakeholder engagement.
Work closely with business partners/stakeholders on strategic initiatives to define scope; perform scope elaboration, make recommendations; collect, interpret and analyze functional and non-functional requirements.
Data discovery and analysis of core data products within key RBC Investor Services applications and data stores/lakes.
Coordinate with domain experts, scrum masters and PMs on gathering detail requirements and document requirements/ functional/non-functional specifications, perform data mapping and data analysis, create wire frames according to existing standards and methodologies.
Closely work with developers to ensure articulation of business requirements; ensuring strategic alignment between Data Management Office and business functions.
Work with business stakeholders during project execution, prepare detailed test plans co-ordinate user involvement and UAT sign off activities.
Have a design thinking mindset for understanding and solving problems.
Work closely and collaboratively with Business and technology stakeholders.


What do you need to succeed?

Must-have:


5+ years of experience in the financial services industry, and working with financial products such as: Equities, Fixed Income, Foreign Exchange, and related Derivatives products
Strong understanding of the data lifecycle, data quality concepts and PL/SQL knowledge.
Experience using business analysis and requirements modelling tools, such as: data flow diagrams, relational data models, business process modelling.
Experience gathering requirements and analyzing custodial and/or financial data.
Good Communication skills with experience presenting to executives, large audiences and conducting facilitation sessions.
In depth knowledge in data governance/stewardship with working knowledge of defining data quality requirements
Master’s in Business Administration (MBA) degree, or similar experience


Nice to Have


Agile Delivery practices including SAFe, Project Management qualification, e.g. PMP, Business Analysis Certification, e.g. CBAP.
Experience with tools like Power BI.
Experience with agile tools like Jira, Confluence, etc.
Experience on large scale Data lakes, Data warehouses, Cloud Solutions.
Prior experience working with GDPR regulations and Data policies & practices.


What’s in it for you?

We thrive on the challenge to be our best, progressive thinking to keep growing, and working together to deliver trusted advice to help our clients thrive and communities prosper. We care about each other, reaching our potential, making a difference to our communities, and achieving success that is mutual.


A comprehensive Total Rewards Program including bonuses and flexible benefits, competitive compensation, commissions, and stock where applicable
Leaders who support your development through coaching and managing opportunities
Ability to make a difference and lasting impact
Work in a dynamic, collaborative, progressive, and high-performing team
A world-class training program in financial services
Flexible work/life balance options
Opportunities to do challenging work


#TechPJ

Job Skills

Agile Methodology, Business Data Analysis, Business Process Modeling, Commercial Acumen, Communication, Critical Thinking, Decision Making, Group Problem Solving, Interpersonal Relationship Management, Requirements Analysis

Additional Job Details

Address:

RBC CENTRE, 155 WELLINGTON ST W:TORONTO

City:

TORONTO

Country:

Canada

Work hours/week:

37.5

Employment Type:

Full time

Platform:

TECHNOLOGY AND OPERATIONS

Job Type:

Regular

Pay Type:

Salaried

Posted Date:

2025-04-17

Application Deadline:

2025-05-09

Note: Applications will be accepted until 11:59 PM on the day prior to the application deadline date above

Inclusion and Equal Opportunity Employment

At RBC, we believe an inclusive workplace that has diverse perspectives is core to our continued growth as one of the largest and most successful banks in the world. Maintaining a workplace where our employees feel supported to perform at their best, effectively collaborate, drive innovation, and grow professionally helps to bring our Purpose to life and create value for our clients and communities. RBC strives to deliver this through policies and programs intended to foster a workplace based on respect, belonging and opportunity for all.

Join our Talent Community

Stay in-the-know about great career opportunities at RBC. Sign up and get customized info on our latest jobs, career tips and Recruitment events that matter to you.

Expand your limits and create a new future together at RBC. Find out how we use our passion and drive to enhance the well-being of our clients and communities at jobs.rbc.com</a/span>

Title: People Analytics Consultant
Description:
Understands and articulates the business case of business questions and the estimated value being delivered. Designs dashboards and analyses to be performed, and appropriate visualization and analytics tools to use. Identifies trends and patterns to address identified business questions and provide insights through reporting and data visualization techniques. Works with other data and analytics professionals to optimize, refine, automate and scale analysis into repeatable analytics solutions and decision support tools.


Builds various reporting dashboards using the most appropriate data extraction, data cleaning and data visualisation techniques.
Provides value through insights, reporting and data visualization techniques. Selects, configures and implements analytics solutions for consistency and repeatability.
Researches and applies continuous improvement in data visualization by identifying trends and patterns to transform raw data into actionable business insights.
Works with different teams, management and stakeholders to enhance the usability and aesthetic appeal of data analytics solutions deployed in the organization.
Translates business needs to technical specifications and evaluates existing data visualization systems in order to improve them.
Develops data visualizations of "large" amounts of data that facilitate the intuitive presentation of data to decision makers.
Documents data flow, systems and processes to improve the design, implementation and management of business/group processes.
Develops tools and delivers training programs for use of reporting tools and self-serve analytics by non-analytical end users; may include delivery of training to audiences.
Focus is primarily on business/group within BMO; may have broader, enterprise-wide focus.
Provides specialized consulting, analytical and technical support.
Exercises judgment to identify, diagnose, and solve problems within given rules.
Works independently and regularly handles non-routine situations.
Broader work or accountabilities may be assigned as needed.


Qualifications:


Foundational level of proficiency:


Technical design optimization.
Decision Making.
Systems Thinking.



Intermediate level of proficiency:


Data visualization.
Data storytelling.
Data mining.
Illustration.
Creative thinking.
Problem Solving.
Verbal & written communication skills.
Collaboration & team skills.
Analytical and problem solving skills.
Data driven decision making.



Advanced level of proficiency:


Insights design.
Insights development and reporting.
Typically between 5 - 7 years of relevant experience and post-secondary degree in related field of study or an equivalent combination of education and experience.
Deep knowledge and technical proficiency gained through extensive education and business experience.
Knowledge and experience developing reports and dashboards for people analytics, workforce planning, HR metrics, and Workday.
Knowledge and experience in data preparation, data analysis, and statistical tool sets including but not limited to SQL, PBI, Python
Knowledge and experience in automation workflows including Power Apps, Power Automate, VBA an asset



Salary:

$68,000.00 - $126,000.00

Pay Type:

Salaried

The above represents BMO Financial Group’s pay range and type.

Salaries will vary based on factors such as location, skills, experience, education, and qualifications for the role, and may include a commission structure. Salaries for part-time roles will be pro-rated based on number of hours regularly worked. For commission roles, the salary listed above represents BMO Financial Group’s expected target for the first year in this position.

BMO Financial Group’s total compensation package will vary based on the pay type of the position and may include performance-based incentives, discretionary bonuses, as well as other perks and rewards. BMO also offers health insurance, tuition reimbursement, accident and life insurance, and retirement savings plans. To view more details of our benefits, please visit: https://jobs.bmo.com/global/en/Total-Rewards

About Us

At BMO we are driven by a shared Purpose: Boldly Grow the Good in business and life. It calls on us to create lasting, positive change for our customers, our communities and our people. By working together, innovating and pushing boundaries, we transform lives and businesses, and power economic growth around the world.

As a member of the BMO team you are valued, respected and heard, and you have more ways to grow and make an impact. We strive to help you make an impact from day one – for yourself and our customers. We’ll support you with the tools and resources you need to reach new milestones, as you help our customers reach theirs. From in-depth training and coaching, to manager support and network-building opportunities, we’ll help you gain valuable experience, and broaden your skillset.

To find out more visit us at https://jobs.bmo.com/ca/en

BMO is committed to an inclusive, equitable and accessible workplace. By learning from each other’s differences, we gain strength through our people and our perspectives. Accommodations are available on request for candidates taking part in all aspects of the selection process. To request accommodation, please contact your recruiter.

Note to Recruiters: BMO does not accept unsolicited resumes from any source other than directly from a candidate. Any unsolicited resumes sent to BMO, directly or indirectly, will be considered BMO property. BMO will not pay a fee for any placement resulting from the receipt of an unsolicited resume. A recruiting agency must first have a valid, written and fully executed agency agreement contract for service to submit resumes.

Title: Business Data Analyst in Toronto, ON (Remote)
Description:
Description:

We are seeking a skilled Business Analyst Contractor to join our team on a project-based basis. The ideal candidate will work closely with business stakeholders to catalog and standardize data from previous analysis conducted on the cost savings and operational efficiency impact our solutions have helped customers realize. This work will play a key role in the creation of impactful value realization metrics to be utilized in various go-to-market activities.
Primary skills of this role are Data Analytics, SQL, Tableau, Salesforce & Google Sheets.




Skills Required:

At least 3 years of experience in data analytics or a related field, preferably with exposure to business value reports, market activities, or performance metrics.
Proficient in developing pivot tables using data analysis tools such as Microsoft Excel, Google Sheets, SQL.
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau).
Experience with Salesforce.
Solid understanding of data cleaning, transformation, and standardization techniques.
Strong attention to detail and the ability to work independently with minimal supervision.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Connect with us LinkedIn, Instagram, Facebook, Twitter

Thinking about a change?

We recognize that the construction industry is changing at a rapid pace and we continually strive to be at the forefront. Our core values empower people to deliver great careers to one another and develop creative solutions for complex problems on some of the most exciting projects. It doesn’t matter what your expertise and craft is – there are no boundaries. We are a group of professionals with a variety of expertise within pre-construction, construction, and post-construction. To learn more, check out our Cradle to Grave services and hear from our team directly about what a career at EllisDon could look like for you. As you can see, we are a diverse bunch.

Above all, we are a group of individuals with unique experiences and at EllisDon, we choose to celebrate the strength in our differences, every day. EllisDon’s commitment to Inclusive Diversity is to work together to create an environment where every employee feels safe to be their true and authentic self. Ultimately, EllisDon’s purpose is to provide people with similar values the opportunity to achieve to their full potential; to deliver that opportunity for great careers to one another; and to contribute meaningfully to the community we share with others.

In case you’re curious, here’s what the industry thinks of us and some of the impacts we've made to the communities we work in.

You As a Data Analyst Will


Collaborate with stakeholders from People & Culture, Finance and consultants to understand data conversion requirements for the HRIS/FMS migration project.
Analyze and map data from legacy HRIS and FMS systems to the new HRIS/FMS platform, ensuring accuracy, completeness, and alignment with the new system's data structures and Business Owners’ requirements.
Perform data quality checks, identify data discrepancies, and implement cleansing strategies to ensure the integrity of migrated data.
Work closely with the implementation team to resolve any data-related issues and support the configuration of the new HRIS/FMS system to meet business needs.
Create and maintain comprehensive documentation of data processes, conversion logic, and data mapping guides.
Participate in data validation activities.


Is this the right role for you?


Bachelor’s degree in mathematics/statistics, engineering, information systems or equivalent. Plus 2-4 years of experience in data analysis.
Proficiency in SQL and experience with database management systems.
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Proficiency with data analysis tools, such as Excel, Python, R and data visualization tools like Power BI or Tableau.
Knowledge of statistical methods and techniques.
Working knowledge of HR and financial business processes is an asset.
Excellent communication and collaboration abilities.
Strong attention to detail and accuracy.


EllisDon is proud to provide this unique career opportunity that provides continuous learning, opportunity for growth, and a competitive compensation package within an environment that is committed to inclusion and respects diversity.

Go ahead and be yourself. We'll pay you for it!

We are an equal opportunity employer. We welcome people of any age, culture, subculture, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, nationality, ethnicity, race, size, mental or physical status, veteran status, religion, language, political opinion, working-style preference, family status, education, and socio-economic status. The EllisDon core values of Integrity and Mutual Respect welcomes everyone, at work and in the community, and our value of Mutual Accountability, means that we all have a role to play. As an EllisDon employee, this will ultimately be your commitment to Inclusive Diversity.

Accommodation for Applicants with disabilities will be made during the recruitment process when requested.

We are committed to providing a positive candidate experience and ensuring timely updates are provided to all candidates. If you haven’t already, be sure to create a profile on our Careers page here to remain up to date on the status of your application and learn about new career opportunities as they arise.

Title: Staff Data Analyst
Description:
S'more About The Team

As a Staff Product Analyst you are an all-rounder who thrives equally working on technical topics as well as value-delivery through insights, presentation and data visualisation. Indeed, your extensive experience and knowledge across technical and business related topics enables you to go “end to end” with a high level of quality and scalability as well as driving best practices within the Product Analytics community. Not limited to one squad or domain, your impact is across the breadth of HelloTech, proactively identifying common needs and pain points across the teams and defining solutions to constantly improve the way we work. So while you are an individual contributor, you are a key owner of best practice across our teams.

Lettuce Share What This Role Will Be Responsible For


Accountable for your teams’ data catalogue and delivery documentation
Collaborate from a technical perspective with data product managers and data engineers to create reusable data products
Collaborate with cross-functional teams to gather requirements and define project objectives while utilising project management skills to plan and execute data-driven projects
Partner widely across the Senior Product organisation (Product, Software Engineering, UX leads) to set strategic priorities and promote a culture rooted in evidence-based decision making.
Communicate actionable insights clearly across the organisation highlighting the “so-whats” of your analyses in order to drive the growth of our business.
Explore and analyse customer behaviour and product performance data in order to detect growth opportunities for the HelloFresh digital product by improving user experience.
Guide and mentor other Product Analysts within our team, defining best practices and providing support to help individuals and the team grow in effectiveness
Review as a technical expert the implementations of multiple teams across domains, continuously improving the deliverables of your teams


Sound a-peeling? Here's what we're looking for


Extensive experience in quantitative analysis roles, ideally including having worked closely with product teams for at least 5 years.
Excellent technical skills applying expert level SQL and Python for both analysis and efficient manipulation of large data sets.
Expert level knowledge of data visualisation tools like Tableau which we use to create compelling visualisations to convey complex data.
Extensive experience working with product stakeholders in setting up A|B experiments, interpreting results and deep diving to understand the impact of particular experiments.
Excellent communication skills, taking complex business problems, articulating these as analytical problems and presenting your findings in a clear and precise way.
Extensive leadership of complex projects you have led, capability building within your team, and through mentorship or direct people management.
A change mindset, the status quo is not an impediment
You are outcome oriented, and can take a business challenge, create actionable analytical insights against it, and align stakeholders on actions to create business value.


Let’s cut to the cheese, this is why you'll love it here


Box Discount - Amazing discounts on 1 box per week! 75% discount on weekly HelloFresh and Chefs Plate meal kits AND 50% off weekly Factor meal box.
Health & Wellness - Health & Dental benefits from day 1, a Health Spending Account, unlimited access to the Headspace app to meet your self-care needs, and 25% discount on GoodLife fitness memberships!
Vacation & PTO - Time off is also an important part of self-care! We offer generous vacation and PTO to help you create a good work-life balance.
Family Benefits - A parental leave top-up program for expectant parents.
Growth & Development - We support your career progression and invest in your continued learning through experiences and initiatives owned by our dedicated L&D team
Work Hard & Have Fun - From team socials to engaging company days, you’ll have plenty of opportunity to experience the fun!
Diversity & Inclusion Initiatives - With impactful ERG’s like FreshPride, Women Empowered and LIMES, we are committed to our diversity, equity & inclusion efforts.
Food Puns - this one is kind of a big dill if you haven’t already noticed. We even have some punny meeting room names!


Flexible Hybrid Approach

At HelloFresh, we know that flexible work arrangements are essential in enabling you to do your best work, while balancing your personal and life needs. Offering remote work flexibility, along with the opportunity to interact and collaborate in the office are all a part of creating a great employee experience.

To meet these needs, we are pleased to provide Flexible Hybrid work. Flexible Hybrid is a people-first approach that is based on choice, trust, personalization, and empowers teams to choose when and how often they work from the office and work from home, in addition to team days and company days. This means a minimum of 2 days in office per week, with most teams in office between 2-3 days a week.

Offering remote work flexibility, along with the opportunity to interact and collaborate in the office are all a part of creating a great employee experience.

To meet these needs, we are pleased to provide Flexible Hybrid work. Flexible Hybrid is a people-first approach that is based on choice, trust, personalization, and empowers teams to choose when and how often they work from the office and work from home, in addition to team days and company days. This means a minimum of 2 days in office per week, with most teams in office between 2-3 days a week.

JR103349

Title: Senior Data Analyst, Data Analytics
Description:
Job Requisition ID #

25WD85676

Aperçu du poste

Autodesk a investi dans la prise de décision basée sur les données, optimisant l'activité, le produit et le coût de notre plateforme. Les cinq prochaines années transformeront notre façon de travailler, avec une explosion du volume de données et une mise à l'échelle de l'IA/ML pour offrir une valeur encore plus grande à nos clients. Nous recherchons un analyste de données senior pour rejoindre l'organisation Platform Strategy and Emerging Technologies d'Autodesk dans ce voyage de transformation et pour favoriser la prise de décision éclairée par les données grâce à des analyses de données et des perspectives avancées.

Vous êtes passionné par la production d'informations proactives et le partenariat avec les parties prenantes pour générer des analyses qui influencent les décisions relatives à la feuille de route des produits. Vous jouerez un rôle essentiel dans l'autonomisation des équipes de produits en faisant émerger des données précieuses sur l'utilisation des clients et des produits et en agissant en tant que partenaire de réflexion, en les guidant dans la transformation des idées en actions stratégiques. Votre expertise dans la découverte des tendances et la traduction de grands flux de données en informations claires et exploitables fera avancer les initiatives stratégiques de la plateforme et améliorera la prise de décision dans l'ensemble de notre organisation.

Ce poste sera basé à Toronto, ON, Canada ou à Montréal, Canada dans une capacité hybride/à distance. Ce poste est placé sous la responsabilité du directeur principal de l'analyse.

Si vous êtes enthousiaste à l'idée d'habiliter les équipes et d'influencer l'organisation avec des connaissances qui mènent au succès, ce poste est pour vous !

Responsabilités


Collaborer avec les chefs de produit et les équipes interfonctionnelles pour identifier, définir et traiter les problèmes et les opportunités de l'entreprise par le biais de l'analyse des données. Utiliser vos compétences analytiques pour obtenir des informations exploitables à partir d'ensembles de données vastes et complexes
Contrôler et suivre les indicateurs de performance clés (KPI), les objectifs et les résultats clés (OKR) dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme, en fournissant des mises à jour et des informations régulières aux principales parties prenantes et en garantissant la visibilité des informations fondées sur les données qui soutiennent les objectifs de l'organisation
Travailler en étroite collaboration avec les équipes de produits, d'ingénierie et d'affaires pour comprendre leurs besoins en matière de données, fournir un soutien analytique et communiquer les résultats de manière claire et concise à des publics techniques et non techniques
Créer des visualisations de données claires et percutantes à l'aide d'outils tels que Power BI, Looker ou similaires, afin de communiquer les résultats et les recommandations aux parties prenantes de l'organisation
Rechercher de manière proactive des données pour soutenir les initiatives de la plateforme PSET, en se concentrant sur la performance, l'engagement des utilisateurs et l'impact global sur l'entreprise
Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles de données avancés et des analyses statistiques pour prévoir les tendances, prédire les résultats et optimiser les processus de prise de décision dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme
Garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données en suivant les meilleures pratiques en matière de collecte, de nettoyage et d'analyse des données, ce qui permet d'obtenir des informations de grande qualité. Identifier et résoudre les divergences de données si nécessaire


Qualifications Minimales


Plus de 5 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de grandes données, la veille stratégique ou un domaine connexe, de préférence dans un environnement technologique ou SaaS
Baccalauréat dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe
Solides compétences en matière d'interrogation et de manipulation de données avec SQL, et maîtrise de langages de programmation tels que Python ou R pour l'analyse et la modélisation des données
Expérience des outils ELT pour entrepôts de données (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Expérience des outils de visualisation de données tels que Looker, Power BI ou similaires, avec la capacité de créer des tableaux de bord clairs, attrayants et percutants. Familiarité avec AWS, Azure ou des plateformes cloud similaires
Aptitudes avérées à l'analyse et à la résolution de problèmes, avec la capacité de travailler de manière autonome sur des ensembles de données complexes et d'en tirer des enseignements exploitables
Connaissance des techniques statistiques et des méthodologies de modélisation pour obtenir des informations approfondies sur les données et soutenir l'analyse prédictive
Forte capacité à communiquer de manière claire et accessible des données complexes et des recommandations aux parties prenantes techniques et non techniques
Esprit d'équipe efficace avec une forte capacité à travailler avec plusieurs fonctions, à s'engager avec diverses parties prenantes et à fournir un soutien basé sur les données pour les initiatives stratégiques


Qualifications Souhaitées


Expérience préalable au sein d'une entreprise SaaS ou d'une organisation d'ingénierie de plateforme
Une bonne connaissance du portefeuille de produits Autodesk et de ses applications dans divers secteurs d'activité est un atout
Maîtrise dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe


Position Overview

Autodesk has invested in data-driven decision-making, optimizing our platform’s business, product, and cost. The next five years will transform how we work, with a surge in data volume and scaling of AI/ML to provide even greater value to our customers. We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join Autodesk’s Platform Strategy and Emerging Technologies organization on this transformative journey and to drive data-informed decision-making through advanced data analytics and insights.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization.

This role will be based in Toronto, ON, Canada or Montreal, Canada in a hybrid/ remote capacity. This role reports into the Senior Manager, Analytics.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities


Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
Proactively mine for data drive insights to support PSET's platform initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact.
Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed


Minimum Qualifications


5+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling
Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives


Preferred Qualifications


Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
Familiarity with Autodesk’s product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline


Learn More / Plus d'information

About Autodesk / À Propos D’Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Bienvenue à Autodesk ! Des choses incroyables sont créées chaque jour avec nos logiciels - des bâtiments les plus écologiques et des voitures les plus propres aux usines les plus intelligentes et aux plus grands films à succès. Nous aidons les innovateurs à transformer leurs idées en réalité, transformant non seulement la façon dont les choses sont faites, mais ce qui peut être fait.

Nous sommes très fiers de notre culture ici chez Autodesk - notre code en matière de culture est au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Nos valeurs et nos méthodes de travail aident nos employés à prospérer et à réaliser leur potentiel, ce qui conduit à des résultats encore meilleurs pour nos clients.

Lorsque vous êtes un employé Autodesk, vous pouvez être entier et authentique et effectuer un travail significatif qui aide à construire un avenir meilleur pour tous. Prêt à façonner le monde et votre avenir? Joignez-vous à nous !

Salary transparency / Transparence salariale

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Le salaire est l'un des éléments de l'offre compétitive d'Autodesk. Les offres sont basées sur l'expérience et la situation géographique du candidat. Outre les salaires de base, nous accordons également une grande importance aux primes annuelles discrétionnaires en espèces, aux commissions pour les fonctions de vente, aux actions ou aux primes d'encouragement à long terme en espèces, ainsi qu'à un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux.

Diversity & Belonging / Diversité et appurtenance

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Nous sommes fiers de cultiver une culture d’appartenance et un milieu de travail équitable où tout le monde peut s’épanouir. Pour en savoir plus, cliquez ici : https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?

Êtes-vous un sous-traitant ou un consultant existant d’Autodesk ?

Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

Veuillez rechercher des emplois vacants et postuler à l’interne (pas sur ce site externe).

  • Rechercher de manière proactive des données pour soutenir les initiatives de la plateforme PSET, en se concentrant sur la performance, l'engagement des utilisateurs et l'impact global sur l'entreprise
  • Développer et mettre en œuvre des modèles de données avancés et des analyses statistiques pour prévoir les tendances, prédire les résultats et optimiser les processus de prise de décision dans le cadre des initiatives de la plateforme
  • Garantir l'exactitude, la cohérence et l'intégrité des données en suivant les meilleures pratiques en matière de collecte, de nettoyage et d'analyse des données, ce qui permet d'obtenir des informations de grande qualité. Identifier et résoudre les divergences de données si nécessaire

Qualifications Minimales

  • Plus de 5 ans d'expérience dans l'analyse de grandes données, la veille stratégique ou un domaine connexe, de préférence dans un environnement technologique ou SaaS
  • Baccalauréat dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe
  • Solides compétences en matière d'interrogation et de manipulation de données avec SQL, et maîtrise de langages de programmation tels que Python ou R pour l'analyse et la modélisation des données
  • Expérience des outils ELT pour entrepôts de données (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
  • Expérience des outils de visualisation de données tels que Looker, Power BI ou similaires, avec la capacité de créer des tableaux de bord clairs, attrayants et percutants. Familiarité avec AWS, Azure ou des plateformes cloud similaires
  • Aptitudes avérées à l'analyse et à la résolution de problèmes, avec la capacité de travailler de manière autonome sur des ensembles de données complexes et d'en tirer des enseignements exploitables
  • Connaissance des techniques statistiques et des méthodologies de modélisation pour obtenir des informations approfondies sur les données et soutenir l'analyse prédictive
  • Forte capacité à communiquer de manière claire et accessible des données complexes et des recommandations aux parties prenantes techniques et non techniques
  • Esprit d'équipe efficace avec une forte capacité à travailler avec plusieurs fonctions, à s'engager avec diverses parties prenantes et à fournir un soutien basé sur les données pour les initiatives stratégiques

Qualifications Souhaitées

  • Expérience préalable au sein d'une entreprise SaaS ou d'une organisation d'ingénierie de plateforme
  • Une bonne connaissance du portefeuille de produits Autodesk et de ses applications dans divers secteurs d'activité est un atout
  • Maîtrise dans un domaine quantitatif tel que la science des données, les statistiques, les mathématiques ou une discipline connexe

Position Overview

Autodesk has invested in data-driven decision-making, optimizing our platform’s business, product, and cost. The next five years will transform how we work, with a surge in data volume and scaling of AI/ML to provide even greater value to our customers. We are looking for a Senior Data Analyst to join Autodesk’s Platform Strategy and Emerging Technologies organization on this transformative journey and to drive data-informed decision-making through advanced data analytics and insights.

You are passionate about delivering proactive insights and partnering with stakeholders to generate analysis that that influence product roadmap decisions. You will play a pivotal role in empowering product teams by surfacing valuable customer and product usage data and acting a thought partner, guiding them in turning insights into strategic actions. Your expertise in uncovering trends and translating large streams of data into clear, actionable insights will drive forward platform strategic initiatives and elevate decision-making across our organization.

This role will be based in Toronto, ON, Canada or Montreal, Canada in a hybrid/ remote capacity. This role reports into the Senior Manager, Analytics.

If you are excited about empowering teams and influencing the organization with insights that drive success, this is the role for you!

Responsibilities

  • Collaborate with product managers and cross-functional teams to identify, define, and address business problems and opportunities through data analysis. Use your analytical skills to derive actionable insights from large and complex datasets
  • Monitor and track key performance indicators (KPIs) and objectives and key results (OKRs) across platform initiatives, providing regular updates and insights to key stakeholders and ensuring visibility into data-driven insights that support organizational goals
  • Work closely with product, engineering, and business teams to understand their data needs, provide analytical support, and communicate findings in a clear and concise manner to technical and non-technical audiences
  • Create clear and impactful data visualizations using tools such as Power BI, Looker, or similar, to communicate findings and recommendations to stakeholders across the organization
  • Proactively mine for data drive insights to support PSET's platform initiatives, focusing on performance, user engagement, and overall business impact.
  • Develop and implement advanced data models and statistical analyses to forecast trends, predict outcomes, and optimize decision-making processes across platform initiatives
  • Ensure data accuracy, consistency, and integrity by following best practices in data collection, cleaning, and analysis, allowing for high-quality insights. Identify and resolve data discrepancies as needed

Minimum Qualifications

  • 5+ years of experience in large data analysis, business intelligence, or a related field, preferably within a technology or SaaS environment
  • Bachelor’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline
  • Strong skills in data querying and manipulation with SQL, and proficiency in programming languages like Python or R for data analysis and modeling
  • Experience with data warehouse ELT tools (Airflow, dbt, Snowflake)
  • Experience with data visualization tools such as Looker, Power BI, or similar, with the ability to create clear, engaging, and impactful dashboards. Familiarity with AWS, Azure or similar cloud platforms
  • Proven analytical and problem-solving abilities, with the capability to work independently on complex datasets and derive actionable insights
  • Knowledge of statistical techniques and modeling methodologies to drive in-depth data insights and support predictive analytics
  • Strong ability to communicate complex data insights and recommendations to technical and non-technical stakeholders in a clear and accessible manner
  • Effective team player with a strong ability to work across functions, engage with diverse stakeholders, and provide data-driven support for strategic initiatives

Preferred Qualifications

  • Prior experience working in a SaaS company or a platform engineering organization is preferred
  • Familiarity with Autodesk’s product portfolio and its applications in various industries is an advantage
  • Master’s degree in a quantitative field such as Data Science, Statistics, Mathematics, or a related discipline

Learn More / Plus d'information

About Autodesk / À Propos D’Autodesk

Welcome to Autodesk! Amazing things are created every day with our software – from the greenest buildings and cleanest cars to the smartest factories and biggest hit movies. We help innovators turn their ideas into reality, transforming not only how things are made, but what can be made.

We take great pride in our culture here at Autodesk – our Culture Code is at the core of everything we do. Our values and ways of working help our people thrive and realize their potential, which leads to even better outcomes for our customers.

When you’re an Autodesker, you can be your whole, authentic self and do meaningful work that helps build a better future for all. Ready to shape the world and your future? Join us!

Bienvenue à Autodesk ! Des choses incroyables sont créées chaque jour avec nos logiciels - des bâtiments les plus écologiques et des voitures les plus propres aux usines les plus intelligentes et aux plus grands films à succès. Nous aidons les innovateurs à transformer leurs idées en réalité, transformant non seulement la façon dont les choses sont faites, mais ce qui peut être fait.

Nous sommes très fiers de notre culture ici chez Autodesk - notre code en matière de culture est au cœur de tout ce que nous faisons. Nos valeurs et nos méthodes de travail aident nos employés à prospérer et à réaliser leur potentiel, ce qui conduit à des résultats encore meilleurs pour nos clients.

Lorsque vous êtes un employé Autodesk, vous pouvez être entier et authentique et effectuer un travail significatif qui aide à construire un avenir meilleur pour tous. Prêt à façonner le monde et votre avenir? Joignez-vous à nous !

Salary transparency / Transparence salariale

Salary is one part of Autodesk’s competitive compensation package. Offers are based on the candidate’s experience and geographic location. In addition to base salaries, we also have a significant emphasis on discretionary annual cash bonuses, commissions for sales roles, stock or long-term incentive cash grants, and a comprehensive benefits package.

Le salaire est l'un des éléments de l'offre compétitive d'Autodesk. Les offres sont basées sur l'expérience et la situation géographique du candidat. Outre les salaires de base, nous accordons également une grande importance aux primes annuelles discrétionnaires en espèces, aux commissions pour les fonctions de vente, aux actions ou aux primes d'encouragement à long terme en espèces, ainsi qu'à un ensemble complet d'avantages sociaux.

Diversity & Belonging / Diversité et appurtenance

We take pride in cultivating a culture of belonging and an equitable workplace where everyone can thrive. Learn more here: https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Nous sommes fiers de cultiver une culture d’appartenance et un milieu de travail équitable où tout le monde peut s’épanouir. Pour en savoir plus, cliquez ici : https://www.autodesk.com/company/diversity-and-belonging

Are you an existing contractor or consultant with Autodesk?

Êtes-vous un sous-traitant ou un consultant existant d’Autodesk ?

Please search for open jobs and apply internally (not on this external site).

Veuillez rechercher des emplois vacants et postuler à l’interne (pas sur ce site externe).

Title: Student, Data Analyst (Fall 2025, 4 Months)
Description:
Choose a workplace that empowers your impact.

Join a global workplace where employees thrive. One that embraces diversity of thought, expertise and experience. A place where you can personalize your employee journey to be — and deliver — your best.

We are a purpose-driven, dynamic and sustainable pension plan. An industry leading global investor with teams in Toronto to London, New York, Singapore, Sydney and other major cities across North America and Europe. We embody the values of our 600,000+ members, placing their best interests at the heart of everything we do.

Join us to accelerate your growth & development, prioritize wellness, build connections, and support the communities where we live and work.

Don’t just work anywhere — come build tomorrow together with us.

Know someone at OMERS or Oxford Properties? Great! If you're referred, have them submit your name through Workday first. Then, watch for a unique link in your email to apply.

The Student, Data Analyst opportunity is focused on collecting, analyzing, and interpreting data to help organizations make informed decisions.

Responsibilities


Data Collection: Gather data from various sources, including databases, spreadsheets, and external sources.
Data Cleaning: Review and clean data to ensure accuracy and completeness.
Data Analysis: Use statistical techniques to analyze data and identify trends or patterns.
Reporting: Create reports and visualizations (e.g., charts, graphs, dashboards) to present findings to stakeholders.
Collaboration: Work with cross-functional teams to understand data needs and provide insights.
Database Management: Assist in maintaining and updating databases and data systems.
Process Improvement: Identify opportunities to improve data collection and analysis processes.


Skills


Proficiency in data analysis tools (e.g., Excel, SQL, Python, R).
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills.
Ability to interpret and present data clearly.
Basic programming skills.
Attention to detail and accuracy.
Experience: Previous experience in a similar role is beneficial but not always required.


Key Duties


Collecting and organizing data from various sources.
Cleaning and preprocessing data to ensure quality.
Analyzing data to identify trends and patterns.
Creating visualizations to communicate findings.
Supporting senior analysts and data scientists in more complex analyses.


You Should Apply If


Current enrollment in an undergraduate degree specializing in Accounting/Finance, Computer Science, or Data Analytics
Strong interest in pursuing a career in Capital Markets or FinTech
An understanding of investment products including bonds, equities, derivatives, and alternative investments
Excellent communication skills (verbal and written)
Analytical, organized, and great attention to detail
Demonstrated ability to work well with others
Proficiency with Microsoft Excel and Microsoft PowerPoint
Experience with data engineering tools (e.g., SQL, PowerBI) is an asset
CSS with pre-processors like Sass being an asset
Object-oriented and functional programming experience
ReactJS, with associated testing and state libraries as an
Web services experience; building and consuming: especially RESTful APIs
AWS, Google GCP, Azure, Heroku and other cloud platform experience is an asset.
Docker, Kubernetes experience is an asset
Git and Github/Gitlab workflow, git command line is an asset.


As one of Canada’s largest defined benefit pension plans, our people-first culture is at its best when our workforce reflects the communities where we live and work — and the members we proudly serve.

From hire to retire, we are an equal opportunity employer committed to an inclusive, barrier-free recruitment and selection process that extends all the way through your employee experience. This sense of belonging and connection is cultivated up, down and across our global organization thanks to our vast network of Employee Resource Groups with executive leader sponsorship, our Purpose@Work committee and employee recognition programs.
